name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"4cb3e281-ce5b-4a78-bf91-0d108e5bd85c","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group: Collection Operations","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5f8efa82-aad1-443d-8a7e-0e78e29eb372","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group of methods provides specialized logic for definitions categorized as ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"LIST_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"MAP_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". While standard definitions track what a variable ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"points to","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":", collection definitions must also track their internal structure (e.g., the values stored at specific dictionary keys or list indices). These methods manage a "memo" (memory) of these internal associations.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"58ab389a-e3fe-45aa-a3ec-4b72822a9ea5","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"b06d4522-2556-4656-873b-6d66ece901c9","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8704de2b-2202-4b38-a1a6-5ffd2057dfc0","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"set_element(key, value)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Records an internal element within a collection.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"7bf4e041-031c-4999-ba0f-1a7b9634d7b5","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the definition type is not a list or map, the operation is ignored.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3e13e033-ca8d-488a-849a-0f358dce9eb4","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It creates an internal ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"memo","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" dictionary if it doesn't already exist and maps the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"key","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"value","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"79f84a3d-67b0-4bcd-85cc-5f87b6946c0f","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This allows the analyzer to track code like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"config['timeout'] = 30","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by storing ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":""30"","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" under the key ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":""timeout"","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"7b6b04ec-c553-459c-900f-990e114ed6ea","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_element(key)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Retrieves the value(s) associated with a specific key or index.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"fdb6d899-12c4-4841-8d25-c476c5532125","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Returns the stored value if found.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e46cba14-4066-4f15-9b1a-faa5f1fdfdd0","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Returns an empty list ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"[]","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" if the key is missing, providing a safe return type for further propagation logic.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"0561c754-9f61-4546-84e9-5f07c3baa9e1","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"del_element(key)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Deletes a specific key-value pair from the collection.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"e4b6449e-12ad-4663-a97b-b236b1a8c632","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the definition is not a collection, it raises a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"DefinitionError","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"03159316-e82e-430e-a68a-d7e529cfb513","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is used to simulate operations like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"del my_dict['key']","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"my_list.pop()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"635c4c37-bf7c-43d5-bb9a-89b87dfd07f1","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"c25a1c54-a8f9-46c9-810b-8064ceb17169","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c1c4f081-d80e-49e9-87b7-c17878b4611d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The analyzer uses these methods when it identifies that a variable is being used as a container.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"650df01a-7a09-4757-80a0-9af646ffb561","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"import utils
from points import Definition

# Create a definition for a configuration dictionary
config_def = Definition("app.config", utils.constants.MAP_DEF)

# 1. Simulate: config['version'] = '1.0.2'
config_def.set_element("version", "1.0.2")

# 2. Simulate: config['debug'] = True
config_def.set_element("debug", "True")

# 3. Retrieve a value later in the analysis
version = config_def.get_element("version")
print(f"Config Version: {version}") # Output: Config Version: 1.0.2

# 4. Handle missing keys safely
port = config_def.get_element("port") 
print(f"Port: {port}") # Output: Port: []

# 5. Remove an element
config_def.del_element("debug")","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bc907fad-901b-4972-a078-50ebc167ac3a","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4ffee3b7-3450-46bd-8cb7-d70d81b9bb7f","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Member Tracking","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": Standard points-to analysis often treats dictionaries as "black boxes." These methods allow Jarvis to perform ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"field-sensitive analysis","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":", tracking how specific pieces of data move into and out of containers.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9fbd5a74-6d5d-4dfe-9251-20531fd7b37d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Safety Overwriting","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"set_element","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method includes a type-check guard to ensure that the analyzer doesn't accidentally attempt to store collection elements on basic variables (like integers or strings).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9d9153e1-76ce-42ff-9f51-d6b67f7bab0c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Memoization","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By using an internal ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"memo","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" attribute, the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Definition","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class can dynamically expand to handle complex data structures only when necessary, keeping memory usage low for simple variable definitions.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1275b8e2-0cd8-4ca5-aa06-2b4932356188","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
